name: get_weather
description: Fetches and displays the current weather at the users location by default, or at a specific location otherwise

location.description: The location to fetch weather for

example.user: When will it start raining?

example.assistant:
Let me look for you.
> get_weather "when will it start raining"

example.user: Thank you, it seems chilly today. can you check the weather in Puerto Rico?

example.assistant:
No problem, let me check
> get_weather general "Puerto Rico"

name: get_time
description: Fetches and displays the current time at the specified location.

location.description: The location to fetch time for

example.user: Thank you, now can you check the time in london?

example.assistant:
No problem, let me check
> get_time London

name: send_text
description: Sends a text message to the target recipients contact, specified by name, with the content of the message parameter

example.user: Can you send a text to my mom?

example.assistant: No problem, what would you like it to say?

example.user: Ask her if she could pick me up gas on the way home from work.

example.assistant:
Sure, I can send a text to your mom, is this ok?
Hey Mom, USER wants to know if you can pick up gas on the way home from work?

No problem, let me send the text
> send_text mom "Hey Mom, USER wants to know if you can pick up gas on the way home from work?"

name: search_internet
description: Searches the internet for information about a certain topic

example.user: What new moon missions are planned?

example.assistant: I'm sorry, but I don't have that information. Would you like me to do a search for it?

example.user: Yes please.

example.assistant:
Sure, let me look for that
> search_internet "New Moon Missions"

example.user: Can you search the internet for information about the ford model a?

example.assistant:
No problem, let me do that
> search_internet "Ford Model A"

name: generate_image
description: Generates a custom image that fits the prompt of the image generation. Can be used to add pictures to stories or just when the user wants an image

prompt.description: The prompt for the image generation

example.user: Can you make me an image of a black dog, but in the style of monet

example.assistant:
Sure thing, let me generate that for you
> generate_image "Black dog in the style of monet"

example.user: Can you paint me a picture of a red and gold sunset?

example.assistant:
Certainly, allow me to generate that for you
> generate_image "Painting of a red and gold sunset"

name: find_nearby_locations
description: Finds nearby locations to the user by default, or at a specific location if specified

location_type.description: The type of location to search for, such as restaurants or movie theaters

location.description: An optional specific location to search

example.user: What restaurants are nearby

example.assistant:
Let me look for you.
> find_nearby_locations restaurant

example.user: Thank you, can you also look for nearby movie theaters to Troy, New York

example.assistant:
No problem, allow me to search for those as well
> find_nearby_locations "movie theater" "Troy, New York"

name: set_alarm_static
description: Sets an alarm at a specified time, that can repeat on any day of the week

time.description: The time to set the alarm, in 24 hour time with no :

repeat_days.description: The specific days of the week to repeat the alarm on, seperated by spaces

example.user: Can you set me an alarm?

example.assistant: Sure thing, when would you like this alarm to go off?

example.user: 8 30 am

example.assistant: And just to confirm, should this be a one time alarm, or are there any days you want it to repeat on?

example.user: every day

example.assistant:
No problem, let me set that alarm for you.
> set_alarm_static 0830 "Monday Tuesday Wednesday Thursday Friday Saturday Sunday"

example.user: Can you also set me an alarm for 12 50 pm?

example.assistant: Sure, should this alarm repeat?

example.user: No, just one time

example.assistant:
Great, I set the alarm for you
> set_alarm_static 1250

name: set_alarm_relative
description: Sets an alarm a certain number of hours from now, that can repeat on any day of the week

hours_past.description: The time in hours from now to set the alarm, in 24 hour time with no :

repeat_days.description: The specific days of the week to repeat the alarm on, seperated by spaces

example.user: Can you set me an alarm?

example.assistant: Sure thing, when would you like this alarm to go off?

example.user: 5 and a half hours from now

example.assistant: Just to make sure, should this alarm be one time, or are there days it should repeat?

example.user: every weekend

example.assistant:
Sure thing, let me set that alarm for you.
> set_alarm_relative 5.5 "Saturday Sunday"

example.user: Can you also set me an alarm for 2 hours ago?

example.assistant: Sure, should this alarm repeat?

example.user: No, just one time

example.assistant:
Great, I set the alarm for you
> set_alarm_relative -2

name: remove_alarm_static
description: Removes an existing one-time or repeating alarm

time.description: The time which the alarm is set is to be removed, in 24 hour time with no :

repeat_days.description: The specific days of the week the alarm to be removed is set, seperated by spaces

example.user: Can you remove an alarm?

example.assistant: Sure thing, which alarm would you like me to remove?

example.user: 8 30 am on Mondays and Thursdays

example.assistant:
Great, I'll remove the alarm for you
> remove_alarm_static 0830 "Monday Thursday"

name: control_music
description: Performs the action specified by music_command on the current music

music_command.description: What the user wants to do to the music (eg pause, unpause, skip, rewind, go back)

example.user: Pause the music

example.assistant:
No problem, pausing the music
> control_music pause

example.user: Can you unpause it please?

example.assistant:
Sure
> control_music unpause

name: smart_device_toggle
description: Turns a smart device on or off, chosen by the name of the device.

on_off.description: Whether the device should be on or off

example.user: Hey can you turn the AC off?

example.assistant:
Sure thing
> smart_device_toggle off AC

name: room_light_toggle
description: Turns all the lights in a room on or off, with the option to specify the room name. If no room name is provided, it will default to the room the user is currently in.

on_off.description: Whether the light should be on or off

room_name.description: Room to control the lights in. This is optional, as by default it will turn the lights on/off in the room the user is in

example.user: Hey can you turn the lights on

example.assistant:
Sure thing
> room_light_toggle on

example.user: Can you turn the lights in the living room off?

example.assistant:
No problem
> room_light_toggle off "living room"

name: room_light_brightness
description: Turns all the lights in a room to a specific brightness, with the option to specify the room name. If no room name is provided, it will default to the room the user is currently in.

brightness.description: The brightness of the light, from 0-100

room_name.description: Room to control the lights in. This is optional, as by default it will change the brightness of the lights in the room the user is in

example.user: Hey can you set the lights to 50

example.assistant:
Sure thing
> room_light_brightness 50

example.user: Can you turn the lights in the bathroom to 100?

example.assistant:
No problem
> room_light_brightness 100 bathroom

name: room_light_brightness_adjust
description: Adjusts the brightness of all the lights in the room by a specified amount brighter or dimmer, with the option to specify the room name. If no room name is provided, it will default to the room the user is currently in.

direction.description: Whether to adjust the lights up/down

brightness.description: How much to adjust the light up/down by. This is optional, as by default it will adjust the lights slightly in the given direction

room_name.description: Room to control the lights in. This is optional, as by default it will turn the lights off in the room the user is in

example.user: Hey can you turn the lights down at bit?

example.assistant:
No problem, turning them down.
> room_light_brightness_adjust down

example.user: And can you turn the lights in the bedroom up by 50?

example.assistant:
No problem
> room_light_brightness_adjust up 50 bedroom

name: room_light_color
description: Turns all the lights in a room to a specific color, with the option to specify the room name. If no room name is provided, it will default to the room the user is currently in.

color.description: The color of the light, can be [Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Purple, Pink, Cyan, Magenta, White, Warm White, Cool White]

room_name.description: Room to control the lights in. This is optional, as by default it will change the color of the lights in the room the user is in

example.user: Hey can you set the lights to a warm white

example.assistant:
Sure thing
> room_light_color "Warm White"

example.user: And can you turn the lights in the kitchen to purple?

example.assistant:
Certainly.
> room_light_color Purple kitchen
